009package Ch11_Circle_Ellipse_Fitting;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.algebraic.CircleFitAlgebraic.FitType.Pratt;
012import static imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.geometric.CircleFitGeometric.FitType.DistanceBased;
013
014import java.util.Locale;
015
016import ij.IJ;
017import ij.ImagePlus;
018import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
019import ij.gui.Overlay;
020import ij.gui.Roi;
021import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
022import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
023import imagingbook.common.color.sets.BasicAwtColor;
024import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
025import imagingbook.common.geometry.circle.GeometricCircle;
026import imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.algebraic.CircleFitAlgebraic;
027import imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.geometric.CircleFitGeometric;
028import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
029import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
030import imagingbook.common.ij.RoiUtils;
031import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
032import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
033
034
035/**
036 * <p>
037 * ImageJ plugin, performs algebraic circle fitting on the current ROI to find an initial circle, followed by geometric
038 * fitting. Algebraic and geometric fitting methods can be selected (see Sec. 11.1 of [1] for details). If successful,
039 * the resulting ellipses are displayed as a vector overlay (color can be chosen). Sample points are either collected
040 * from the ROI (if available) or collected as foreground pixels (values &gt; 0) from the image. If no image is
041 * currently open, the user is asked to create a suitable sample image.
042 * </p>
043 * <p>
044 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
045 * (2022).
046 * </p>
047 *
048 * @author WB
049 * @version 2022/10/03
050 */
051public class Circle_Fitting implements PlugInFilter {
052        
053        static CircleFitAlgebraic.FitType AlgebraicFitMethod = Pratt;
054        static CircleFitGeometric.FitType GeometricFitMethod = DistanceBased;
055        static boolean UsePointsFromRoi = false;
056        
057        private static BasicAwtColor AlgebraicFitColor = BasicAwtColor.Red;
058        private static BasicAwtColor GeometricFitColor = BasicAwtColor.Blue;
059        private static double StrokeWidth = 0.5;
060        
061        private ImagePlus im;
062        
063        /**
064         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image
065         * is currently open.
066         */
067        public Circle_Fitting() {
068                if (IjUtils.noCurrentImage()) {
069                        if (DialogUtils.askForSampleImage()) {
070                                IjUtils.run(new Circle_Make_Random()); //runPlugIn(Circle_Make_Random.class);
071                        }                       
072                }
073        }
074
075        
076        @Override
077        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
078                this.im = im;
079                return DOES_ALL;
080        }
081
082        @Override
083        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
084                Roi roi = im.getRoi();
085                UsePointsFromRoi = (roi != null);
086                
087                if (!runDialog()) {
088                        return;
089                }
090                
091                Pnt2d[] points = (UsePointsFromRoi) ?
092                                RoiUtils.getOutlinePointsFloat(roi) :
093                                IjUtils.collectNonzeroPoints(ip);
094                
095                IJ.log("Found points " + points.length);
096                if (points.length < 3) {
097                        IJ.error("At least 3 points are required, but found only " + points.length);
098                        return;
099                }
100                
101                Overlay oly = im.getOverlay();
102                if (oly == null) {
103                        oly = new Overlay();
104                        im.setOverlay(oly);
105                }       
106                ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter(oly); 
107                
108                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
109                CircleFitAlgebraic fitA = CircleFitAlgebraic.getFit(AlgebraicFitMethod, points);
110                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
111                
112                GeometricCircle ac = fitA.getGeometricCircle();
113                if (ac == null) {
114                        IJ.log("Algebraic fit: no result!");
115                        return;
116                }
117                
118                GeometricCircle initCircle = ac;
119                
120                IJ.log("Initial fit (algebraic):");
121                IJ.log("  circle: " + initCircle.toString());
122                IJ.log(String.format(Locale.US, "  error = %.3f", initCircle.getMeanSquareError(points)));
123                
124                ColoredStroke initialStroke = new ColoredStroke(StrokeWidth, AlgebraicFitColor.getColor());
125                ola.addShapes(initCircle.getShapes(3), initialStroke);
126
127                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
128                CircleFitGeometric fitG = CircleFitGeometric.getFit(GeometricFitMethod, points, initCircle);
129                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
130                
131                GeometricCircle finalCircle = fitG.getCircle();
132                if (finalCircle == null) {
133                        IJ.log("Geometric fit: no result!");
134                        return;
135                }
136                
137                IJ.log("Final fit (geometric):");
138                IJ.log("  circle: " + finalCircle.toString());
139                IJ.log(String.format(Locale.US, "  error = %.3f", finalCircle.getMeanSquareError(points)));
140                IJ.log("  iterations = " + fitG.getIterations());
141
142                ColoredStroke finalStroke = new ColoredStroke(StrokeWidth, GeometricFitColor.getColor());
143                ola.addShapes(finalCircle.getShapes(3), finalStroke);
144        }
145
146        // ------------------------------------------
147        
148        private boolean runDialog() {
149                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
150                
151                gd.addMessage(DialogUtils.makeLineSeparatedString(
152                                "This plugin performs algebraic + geometric circle fitting,",
153                                "either to ROI points (if available) or foreground points",
154                                "collected from the pixel image."
155                                ));
156                
157                gd.addCheckbox("Use ROI (float) points", UsePointsFromRoi);
158                gd.addEnumChoice("Algebraic fit method", AlgebraicFitMethod);
159                gd.addEnumChoice("Algebraic ellipse color", AlgebraicFitColor);
160                gd.addEnumChoice("Geometric fit method", GeometricFitMethod);
161                gd.addEnumChoice("Geometric ellipse color", GeometricFitColor);
162                
163                gd.showDialog();
164                if (gd.wasCanceled())
165                        return false;
166                
167                UsePointsFromRoi = gd.getNextBoolean();
168                AlgebraicFitMethod = gd.getNextEnumChoice(CircleFitAlgebraic.FitType.class);
169                AlgebraicFitColor = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
170                GeometricFitMethod = gd.getNextEnumChoice(CircleFitGeometric.FitType.class);
171                GeometricFitColor = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
172                
173                return true;
174        }
175
176
177
178}
